newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: NATO ASPIRING CZECHS "UNDERSTAND" U.S. IRAQ ACTION.
newsitem.headline: NATO ASPIRING CZECHS "UNDERSTAND" U.S. IRAQ ACTION.

text.p: The Czech Republic, which hopes to join the NATO defence alliance, understands the U.S. attack on Iraq, Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus said.
But speaking after meeting President Vaclav Havel on Tuesday evening, Klaus stopped short of explicitly supporting the action although he blamed Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein.
"Saddam Hussein has caused the present situation by his completely absurd attack on the Kurdish positions in northern Iraq," Klaus said on Czech Radio.

"Naturally, he bears full responsibility," Klaus said. "I can also say that the president and I have agreed on the phrase that in the situation that has arisen we understand the action taken by the United States."
Prague has warm relations with the United States and the Czech army sent troops to the U.S.-led coalition which drove Iraq from Kuwait five years ago.
The Czech Republic, along with Poland and Hungary, is considered a front runner to become the first post-communist country to join the Western defence alliance.
NATO foreign ministers are expected to tackle the issue of which countries from the former communist bloc will join the alliance when in December.
